name: Daniel Maschmann
title: M. Sc.
cv: Daniel Maschmann has been a student research assistant since January 2019, funded by the DFG Initiative of Excellence. He is responsible for establishing the link to the “Epistemology of the Large Hadron Collider” DFG Research Group at the Physics Department of the RWTH Aachen University. He received a Master’s in physics at RWTH Aachen University in 2018 and is currently in a transition year before starting his PhD in physics, working on a research project on galaxy mergers with the Paris Observatory.  He is also studying literature, linguistics and philosophy at the RWTH.
field: Physics (M. Sc., absolved); Literary and Linguistic Studies (B.A.)
